thread.title: White House Economic Adviser Says Benefits of Tariffs Would Outweigh Costs

author: Kate Davidson
title: White House Economic Adviser Says Benefits of Tariffs Would Outweigh Costs

organizations.name: white house council of economic advisers

text:
WASHINGTON—New U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum could harm companies that rely on those products, but the costs would likely be outweighed by the benefits to national security, the chairman of the White House Council of Economic Advisers said Wednesday.
Kevin Hassett told lawmakers that steel tariffs imposed during the George W. Bush administration were shown to have big benefits for the U.S. steel industry, but caused “some harm” to U.S. companies that use steel and faced higher costs.
...
